messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr repository?

The ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr repository exists to provide a fix implemented on top of the original ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr by hnmr293, as the original author has not been approving any pull requests for a while.
Who are the main contributors credited for the ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr repository?
The main contributors credited for the ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr repository are hnmr93, spacepxl, and WeeBull.
What is the X/Y/Z-plot example in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
The X/Y/Z-plot example in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr demonstrates the use of seeds, steps, cfg scales, models, and VAEs in generating plots.
What is the difference between simple merge and merge block weighted in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
The simple merge is a basic merging technique, while the merge block weighted (BMW) is a more advanced merging method that uses block weights, thanks to @bbc-mc.
What is the purpose of the LatentToImage node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
The LatentToImage node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr is used to convert a 4-channel latent tensor to 4 grayscale images.
What does the KSamplerXYZ node do in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
The KSamplerXYZ node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr generates latents with values.
What is the function of the StateDictMergerBlockWeightedMulti node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
The StateDictMergerBlockWeightedMulti node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr merges two models with per-block weights.
What is the purpose of the GridImage node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr?
The GridImage node in ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr generates a single image with a specific number of columns.
